title: Onboarding New Signup via Branch deeplinks *[requires install from deeplink]
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user does not have BP app installed previously (delete any/all instances from device)
AND user has been given a branch deeplink to access the app
custom_steps:
WHEN user accesses the deeplink 
AND user in directed to App store
AND user installed the app
AND user creates a new account and completes onboarding
custom_expected:
THEN the deferred deep link resolves and user navigates to the view referenced in the embedded Branch quick link

** Examples: deeplink of https://bp.mlb.com/cubs directs user to Cubs team page, while deeplink of https://bp.mlb.com/Wallet directs user to Wallet page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user accesses the deeplink - https://bp.mlb.com/cubs
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is directed to App store prompting install of Ballpark App
THEN installation of BP app completes successfully

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user installs* BP 
AND user opens BP app

*Testflight build can be substituted, if desired version has not been released
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is presented with Welcome Screen

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User taps option to get started
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN User is presented with Sign Up screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user enters valid data for all the fields
AND user submits continue
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN account creation is successful 
AND user is logged in successful
AND BP app is navigated to the view referenced in the embedded Branch quick link 

(If https://bp.mlb.com/cubs was accessed initially, then user should be shown the Cubs team page)

custom_steps_separated.content:
Remove BPP APP 

REPEAT steps 1 through 6, accessing a different branch deeplink that directs user to Home - https://bp.mlb.com/Wallet
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN account creation is successful 
AND user is logged in successful
AND BP app is navigated to the view referenced in the embedded Branch quick link 

(If https://bp.mlb.com/Wallet was accessed initially, then user should be shown the Wallet page)

custom_steps_separated.content:
Remove BPP APP 

REPEAT steps 1 through 6, accessing a different branch deeplink that directs user to Home - https://bp.mlb.com/BallparkHome
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN account creation is successful 
AND user is logged in successful
AND BP app is navigated to the view referenced in the embedded Branch quick link 

(If https://bp.mlb.com/BallparkHome was accessed initially, then user should be shown the Home page)

title: Fresh installation / Upgraded installation

GIVEN users are loading the app 
AND the BP app version is 11.3.0, at minimum*

*11.3.0 introduces Rapid Onboarding
custom_steps:
WHEN the user launches Ballpark for the first time after installation
OR the user launches Ballpark for the first time after upgraded installation
custom_expected:
THEN the Ballpark branded splash screen will be displayed

WIKI: [Splash Screen](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-6388)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user loading the app for the first time on their devices
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app loads Get Started page
AND the header text shown is "Welcome to Ballpark. Everything you need for your ballpark visit."
AND 'Get Started' button shown
AND 'Have a MLB account? Log In' text beneath the Get Started button

title: First/Last Name field required
custom_preconds:
GIVEN The Ballpark app has been freshly installed
AND the user has navigate to the Sign up page
AND email address entered by the user is a new acct (not prev onboarded)
AND minimum password requirements have been satisfied
AND the DOB fields have correct data (eligible for a new acct, age > 13 yrs) and format
custom_expected:
AND The First Name field is populated
AND the Last Name field is populated

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps the SIGN UP Button without First/Last name input
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'First and Last Name are required.' will be displayed with red text under the field
AND the account creation is prevented with user unable to proceed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters valid data for all other fields other than First/Last name 
AND the user enters text for First Name
BUT the user DOEST NOT enter text for Last Name
AND the user attempts to create the account by tapping SIGN UP button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'First and Last Name are required.' will be displayed with red text under the field
AND the account creation is prevented with user unable to proceed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters valid data for all other fields other than First/Last name 
AND the user enters text for Last Name
BUT the user DOEST NOT enter text for First Name
AND the user attempts to create the account by tapping SIGN UP button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'First and Last Name are required.' will be displayed with red text under the field
AND the account creation is prevented with user unable to proceed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters valid data for all other fields other than First/Last name 
AND the user enters text for Last Name
BUT the user enters text for First Name
AND the user attempts to create the account by tapping SIGN UP button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the account creation is successful
AND the user is shown the Home page

title: Password text field validation
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user loads the app for the very first time on their mobile device.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps into Password text field
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the device keyboard is presented

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters a password with a special character
AND the user attempts to create the account by tapping SIGN UP button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN "Password must contains 8-15 characters, one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, and one number. No special characters allowed." is shown below Password field.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters a password without at least one uppercase letter
AND the user attempts to create the account by tapping SIGN UP button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN "Password must contains 8-15 characters, one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, and one number. No special characters allowed." is shown below Password field.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters a password without at least one lowercase letter
AND the user attempts to create the account by tapping SIGN UP button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN "Password must contains 8-15 characters, one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, and one number. No special characters allowed." is shown below Password field.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters a password without at least one number
AND the user attempts to create the account by tapping SIGN UP button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN "Password must contains 8-15 characters, one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, and one number. No special characters allowed." is shown below Password field.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters a password containing 7 characters or less
AND the user attempts to create the account by tapping SIGN UP button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN "Password must contains 8-15 characters, one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, and one number. No special characters allowed." is shown below Password field.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters a password containing 16 characters or more
AND the user attempts to create the account by tapping SIGN UP button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN "Password must contains 8-15 characters, one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, and one number. No special characters allowed." is shown below Password field.

title: Birthdate validation
custom_preconds:
GIVEN The Ballpark app has been freshly installed
AND the user has navigate to the Sign up page
AND The First Name field is populated
AND the Last Name field is populated
AND minimum password requirements have been satisfied

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps the SIGN UP Button without birthdate input
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'Please enter a valid birthdate.' will be displayed with red text under the field
AND the account creation is prevented with user unable to proceed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters valid data for all other fields other than birthdate
AND the user enters an invalid birthdate of 00/00/0000
AND the user attempts to create the account by tapping SIGN UP button

REPEAT STEP FOR:
00/00/0000
99/99/9999
13/01/2000
01/32/2000
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'Please enter a valid birthdate.' will be displayed with red text under the field
AND the account creation is prevented with user unable to proceed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters a valid birthdate in proper format 00/00/0000,
BUT user provides a date of birth that is less than 13 years from the current date
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'Sign Up Error' message prompt is shown with 'You are ineligible to complete registration' text 
AND the message prompt displays 'OK' link

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps 'OK' within the Sign Up Error prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is returned to the sign up page
AND the account creation is prevented

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters valid data for all other fields other than birthdate
AND the user enters a valid birthdate providing a date of birth that is more than 13 years from the current date
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the account creation is successful
AND the user is shown the Home page

title: Duplicate account creation
custom_preconds:
GIVEN The Ballpark app has been freshly installed 
AND the user has navigate to the Sign up page
AND The First Name field is populated
AND the Last Name field is populated
AND minimum password requirements have been satisfied
AND the Birthday fields are populated (and acceptable - ie. above 13 yrs old)
custom_steps:
WHEN the user enters an existing Email address that confirms to standard email rules (i.e example@example.com) 
AND the user taps the SIGN UP Button
custom_expected:
THEN BP app will display an error message 'Sign Up Error - An account with this email already exists'
AND the client will not allow the duplicated acct to be created

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigate to the Sign Up page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Sign Up page displays

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters required info for all fields 
AND the user enters an existing Email address that confirms to standard email rules (i.e example@example.com) 
AND taps the SIGN UP Button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN BP app will display an error message 'Sign Up Error - An account with this email already exists' with an OK cta
AND the client will not allow the duplicated acct to be created

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'OK' within the Sign Up Error prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is returned to the Sign Up page

title: Newsletters/Promotions opt in validation [PROXY]*
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is on the Create an MLB account Sign Up page

*validation requires connecting to a Proxy(i.e Charles) to confirm value being passed to Profile service

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user views the Sign Up page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN 'Create an MLB account to access your digital tickets'/Sign Up page is shown
AND all text fields are unpopulated
AND "I would like to receive newsletters and promotions from MLB.com and its partners.' radio button is shown above the Sign Up button

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters valid data for all fields
AND the email entered does not have a previous MLB account
AND the user opts OUT of Newsletters and Promotions by toggling it OFF
AND the user taps Sign Up button

*requires connection to a proxy tool
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the account is created successfully
AND the user is shown the Home Page
AND the request to https://profile.mlb.com service should contain 'commercialEmailsOptin": false' within the profile struct. (confirmed with Proxy tool)

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN the user views the Sign Up page
WHEN the user enters valid data for all fields
AND the email entered does not have a previous MLB account
AND the user opts IN of Newsletters and Promotions by toggling it ON
AND the user taps Sign Up button

*requires connection to a proxy tool
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the account is created successfully
AND the user is shown the Home Page
AND the request to https://profile.mlb.com service should contain 'commercialEmailsOptin": true' within the profile struct.(confirmed with Proxy tool)

title: Forgot Password? link
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app
AND the user has existing account
AND the user is on Log In page
custom_steps: WHEN user taps 'Forgot Password?' link
custom_expected:
THEN Reset Password Page is shown allowing user to reset their password

[THIS CASE REQUIRES A PASSWORD CHANGE TO OCCUR - IT IS BEST TO ONBOARD A NEW ACCT WITH A VALID EMAIL ADDRESS, TO PREVENT CHANGING PW ON SHARED TEST ACCOUNTS]

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is viewing the Reset Password page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Reset Password will be shown as the title with a back navigation arrow
AND beneath the header there is text to instruct the user to reset password: "Please enter your MLB account email address. We'll send you an email with a link to reset your password."
AND an email field is shown above 'SUBMIT' button

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN email address input field is unpopulated
and the "SUBMIT" button is tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN an error prompt is shown: "Reset Password Failed." - "Please enter a valid email address."

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps "OK" on error prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Reset Password page is shown as the title with a back navigation arrow

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user enters an Email address that does not conform to standard email rules (i.e @ symbol missing, domain missing) 
AND taps the Submit Button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN an error prompt is shown: "Reset Password Failed." - "Please enter a valid email address."

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps "OK" on error prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Reset Password page is shown as the title with a back navigation arrow

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user disables the network (setting device to airplane mode is one way to achieve this)
WHEN the user is viewing the Reset Password page
AND the user enters an Email address that does confirm to standard email rules (i.e example@example.com)
AND taps the Submit Button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN an error prompt is shown: "Reset Password Failed." - "Password recovery failed."

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps "OK" on error prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Reset Password page is shown as the title with a back navigation arrow

custom_steps_separated.content:
GIVEN user enables the network 
WHEN the user is viewing the Reset Password page
AND the user enters an Email address that does confirm to standard email rules (i.e example@example.com)
AND taps the Submit Button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN Reset Password page is shown as the title with a back navigation arrow
AND the email field and submit are no longer shown, INSTEAD is shown "Reset password instructions have been sent to your email."

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user accesses their email containing a Reset Password link
AND user completes needed actions to successfully reset the password
AND user returns to BP app (Reset Password page, if prev minimized)
AND user logs in with new password
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is logged in successfully with newly reset password.

custom_preconds:

*Invalid Email address format
*Invalid PW format

WHEN the user enters valid entry for Sign Up
AND the user taps Create Account and the user is authenticated from logging in

AND they are routed to the home page

custom_preconds:

*Smart Lock feature introduced with 11.6.0, but refactored with 12.3.0 [BPA-6590](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-6590 )

Story - https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-7504 August 1.2024

Note: if smartlock discontinues to show, may want to check DataDog for throttling -- "Couldn't start One Tap UI: 16: Caller has been temporarily blocked due to too many canceled sign-in prompts."
custom_steps:
WHEN the user launches Ballpark for the first time after installation
OR the user launches Ballpark for the first time after upgraded installation
custom_expected:
Notes:

Auto-sign in only works for users that have a single set of credentials saved. For users that have more than one set of credentials, a prompt will be displayed and they will have to choose which account they want to sign in with before pressing “continue”.

One Tap will throttle users after x amount of sign-in attempts in a 24-hour period. For testing purposes, you can reset the throttle by dialing *#*#66382723#*#*.

Designs: [figma](https://www.figma.com/file/M3vqmrFe2eJlofe392hAqY/Specs?node-id=259%3A1765) 

Testing Notes:

Go to passwords.google.com to remove saved credentials
Since this toast is controlled by Google libraries, accessibility functionality is out of our control. If there are any elements that are not functional, additional stories can be generated to account for them.
